intro: Hermione dubia, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and enigmatic flowering plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, pale greenish-white flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. The plant has a unique morphology, featuring a slender, often submerged stem and a single, showy bloom. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires specific conditions to flourish. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, Hermione dubia is considered a conservation concern in many regions.
